sections.purpose: To measure the temperature of liquids and ambient air.
sections.scope: Applicable to general laboratory testing in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Inspect the thermometer for cracks or breaks in the liquid column.
Immerse the bulb into the center of the liquid/medium.
Wait for the reading to stabilize before recording.
Read the temperature at eye level to avoid parallax error.
Clean the thermometer with distilled water after each use.
Dry with a soft tissue and store in its protective sleeve.
Verify accuracy against a reference thermometer annually.
precautions: Do not use the thermometer as a stirring rod.
Avoid sudden temperature shocks which can break the glass.
Dispose of broken thermometers as hazardous waste.
Store vertically or at an angle to prevent separation of the liquid.
Use alcohol thermometers in place of mercury where possible.
